message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Pufferfish contains tetrodotoxin, which blocks sodium channels, leading to decreased cell membrane permeability to sodium ions. This can cause paralysis and respiratory failure.

The ingestion of pufferfish can cause Tetrodotoxin poisoning, which blocks voltage-gated sodium channels and decreases cell membrane permeability to sodium ions. This leads to muscle weakness and paralysis, which can ultimately result in respiratory failure.
